sen.j: 小弓公方（おゆみくぼう）は、関東における足利氏（基氏流）の公方家のひとつ。
sen.e: Based in Kanto region, Oyumi-kubo was one of the "Kubo" (shogunate) families of the Ashikaga clan, which belonged to "Motouji-ryu" (the Motouji lineage).
Based in Kanto region, Oyumi-kubo was one of the "Kubo" (shogunate) families of the Ashikaga clan, which belonged to "Motouji-ryu" (the Motouji lineage).
Oyumi-kubo was one of Kubo (shogunate) families of the Ashikaga clan (of Motouji-ryu or the Motouji lineage) in Kanto region.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 下総国千葉郡小弓城（現在の千葉市中央区_(千葉市)生実・同緑区_(千葉市)おゆみ野の一帯）に本拠地があったことから、その名がある。
sen.e: The name has its origin in Oyumi Castle in Chiba County of Shimousa Province (the present whole area of both Oyumino, Midori Ward, Chiba City & Omi, Chuo Ward, Chiba City), where they put their base.

The name has its origin in Oyumi Castle in Chiba County of Shimousa Province (the present whole area of both Oyumino, Midori Ward, Chiba City & Omi, Chuo Ward, Chiba City), where they established their base.

The name has its origin in Oyumi-jo Castle in Chiba County of Shimousa Province (the present whole area of both Oyumino, Midori Ward, Chiba City & Omi, Chuo Ward, Chiba City), where they established their base.

sen.j: 古河公方の分家で本家と覇権を争ったが、足利義明・足利頼純の2代にわたって受け継がれ、後の喜連川藩の元となった。
sen.e: Being the branch family of "Koga-kubo" (descendants of one of the Ashikaga families that held the office of the Kanto district administrator), Oyumi-kubo struggled for supremacy with the head family Koga-kubo, and the inheritance of Oyumi-kubo from Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA to Yorizumi ASHIKAGA laid the base of the Kitsuregawa Clan in a later years.

Being the branch family of "Koga-kubo" (descendants of one of the Ashikaga families that held the office of the Kanto district administrator), Oyumi-kubo struggled for supremacy with the head family Koga-kubo, and the inheritance of Oyumi-kubo from Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA to Yorizumi ASHIKAGA laid the base for the Kitsuregawa Clan in later years.

Although it was a branch family of Koga-kubo (descendants of one of the Ashikaga families that held the office of the Kanto region administrator), the both families battled each other for supremacy, but it was inherited through two generations from Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA to Yorizumi ASHIKAGA and became the foundation for the Kitsuregawa clan in later years.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 古河公方家の祖である鎌倉公方家は、足利尊氏の子の足利基氏以来代々関東を支配していた。
sen.e: The Kamakura-kubo family, which was the forefathers of Koga-kubo, ruled the Kanto district for generations from the era of Motouji ASHIKAGA, who was the son of Takauji ASHIKAGA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The Kamakura-kubo family, who were the forefathers of Koga-kubo, ruled the Kanto district for generations from the era of Motouji ASHIKAGA, who was the son of Takauji ASHIKAGA.
The Kamakura-kubo family, who were the forefathers of Koga-kubo, ruled the Kanto region for generations from the era of Motouji ASHIKAGA, who was the son of Takauji ASHIKAGA.

sen.j: しかし同家は次第に本家（足利義詮系統の京都将軍家）の足利氏と将軍位などをめぐって対立する姿勢を見せ始める。
sen.e: And the family began to show an opposing attitude about the shogunate & others against the Ashikaga head family, or the Kyoto shogunate family whose forefather was Yoshiakira ASHIKAGA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: And the family began to show opposition to the shogunate & others against the Ashikaga head family, as well as the Kyoto shogunate family whose forefather was Yoshiakira ASHIKAGA.
The family, however, began to show its opposition to the Ashikaga head family (the Kyoto shogunate family whose forefather was Yoshiakira ASHIKAGA) over the shogunate's succession and so on.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: そして遂に、第4代公方・足利持氏の時代には第6代将軍・足利義教と武力衝突（永享の乱）するまでに至った。
sen.e: And in the end, during the era of the fourth Kamakura-kubo Mochiuji ASHIKAGA, the conflict resulted in an armed clash (the Eikyo War) with the sixth shogunate Yoshinori ASHIKAGA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In the end, during the era of the fourth Kamakura-kubo Mochiuji ASHIKAGA, the conflict resulted in an armed clash (the Eikyo War) with the sixth shogunate Yoshinori ASHIKAGA.
In the end, during the era of the fourth Kamakura-kubo Mochiuji ASHIKAGA, the conflict resulted in an armed clash (the Eikyo War) with the sixth shogunate Yoshinori ASHIKAGA.

sen.j: これに敗れた持氏は自害を余儀なくされ、鎌倉公方家は一時滅亡した。
sen.e: Suffered defeat in the war, Mochiuji was forced to commit suicide, so the Kamakura-kubo family was separated for some time.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Suffering defeat in the war, Mochiuji was forced to commit suicide, so the Kamakura-kubo family was separated for some time.
Mochiuji was defeated in the war and forced to commit suicide, which temporarily overthrew the Kamakura-kubo family.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 持氏の遺児の多くも結城合戦などで義教に殺されている。
sen.e: Most of Mochiuji's orphans were also killed by Yoshinori in the Yuki War or other wars.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Most of Mochiuji's orphans were also killed by Yoshinori in the Yuki War or other wars.
Most of Mochiuji's orphans were also killed by Yoshinori in the Yuki War or in other wars.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: しかし、義教が嘉吉の乱で死去すると鎌倉公方再興の気運が高まり、持氏の遺児である足利成氏が鎌倉公方として復帰する。
sen.e: But after Yoshinori died in the Kakitsu War, a tendency toward the revival of Kamakura-kubo grew, and Shigeuji ASHIKAGA, the orphan of Mochiuji, returned as Kamkura-kubo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: But after Yoshinori died in the Kakitsu War, a tendency toward the revival of Kamakura-kubo grew, and Shigeuji ASHIKAGA, the orphan of Mochiuji, returned as Kamkura-kubo.
After Yoshinori died in the Kakitsu War, however, calls for the restoration of the Kamakura-kubo grew, and Shigeuji ASHIKAGA (an orphan of Mochiuji) returned as Kamkura-kubo.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 成長した成氏は、幕府や関東管領上杉氏と対立して（享徳の乱）鎌倉を追われた。
sen.e: When Mochiuji grew up, he came into conflicts both with the Muromachi shogunate & the Uesugi clan assuming "Kanto Kanrei" (A shogunate deputy for the Kanto district), which is called the Kyotoku War, and Mochiuji was kicked out of Kamakura during the war.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: When Mochiuji grew up, he came into conflict with both the Muromachi shogunate & the Uesugi clan assuming "Kanto Kanrei" (A shogunate deputy for the Kanto district), which is called the Kyotoku War, and Mochiuji was kicked out of Kamakura during the war.
After grown up, Mochiuji confronted the bakufu and the Kanto Kanrei (a shogunal deputy of the Kanto region) Uesugi clan (in the Kyotoku War), and Mochiuji was expelled from Kamakura during the war.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: しかし1455年には下総国古河城を本拠として独立した勢力を保ち、以後古河公方と呼ばれる。
sen.e: But in 1455, Mochiuji established an independent power, putting its base at Koga-jo Castle in Shimousa Province, so thereafter he was called Koga-kubo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In 1455, Mochiuji established an independent power, putting its base at Koga-jo Castle in Shimousa Province, so thereafter he was called Koga-kubo.
In 1455, however, Mochiuji based himself at Koga-jo Castle in Shimousa Province and retained his power independently there ever since he was called Koga-kubo.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 成氏の死後、古河公方家では内紛が頻発したが、その内紛のひとつに、第2代公方であった足利政氏と、第3代公方であった足利高基父子による対立があった（永正の乱）。
sen.e: After Shigeuji died, internal conflicts within the Koga-kubo family occurred frequently, and one of them was that between the second Koga-kubo Masauji ASHIKAGA & the third Koga-kubo Takamoto ASHIKAGA (Masauji's son), which is called the Eisho War.

After Shigeuji died, internal conflicts within the Koga-kubo family occurred frequently, and one of them was that between the second Koga-kubo Masauji ASHIKAGA & the third Koga-kubo Takamoto ASHIKAGA (Masauji's son), which is called the Eisho War.

After the death of Shigeuji, internal conflicts frequently occurred in the Koga-kubo family, one of which was that between the second Koga-kubo, Masauji ASHIKAGA, and his son and the third Koga-kubo, Takamoto ASHIKAGA (the Eisho War).
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 高基には、空然という僧侶となっていた弟がいた。
sen.e: Takamoto had a younger brother "Konen," who was a Buddhist priest.
Takamoto had a younger brother "Konen," who was a Buddhist priest.
Takamoto had a younger brother "Konen," who was a Buddhist priest.

sen.j: そして上総国に、甲斐国武田氏の分家である真里谷武田氏がいた。
sen.e: And in Kazusa Province there was the Mariya-Takeda clan, which was a branch family of the Kai-Takeda clan.
And in Kazusa Province there was the Mariya-Takeda clan, which was a branch family of the Kai-Takeda clan.
And in Kazusa Province there was the Mariya-Takeda clan, which was a branch family of the Kai-Takeda clan.

sen.j: この真理谷氏は武田信満の次男・武田信長が古河公方であった足利成氏の家臣となって、その命令を受けて上総に攻め込み、同地で関東管領である上杉氏の所領を横領するなどして戦国大名化した一族である。
sen.e: The forefather of the Mariya clan was Nobunaga TAKEDA (the second son of Nobumitsu TAKEDA), who became the vassal of Koga-kubo Shigeuji ASHIKAGA, invaded Kazusa Province on the order of Shigeuji, embezzled the territory of the Kanto Kanrei Uesugi clan in the province, and became a warload.

The forefather of the Mariya clan was Nobunaga TAKEDA (the second son of Nobumitsu TAKEDA), who became the vassal of Koga-kubo Shigeuji ASHIKAGA, invaded Kazusa Province on the order of Shigeuji, embezzled the territory of the Kanto Kanrei Uesugi clan in the province, and became a warload.

Nobunaga TAKEDA (the second son of Nobumitsu TAKEDA), who had became a vassal of the Koga-kubo, Shigeuji ASHIKAGA, invaded Kazusa Province as ordered by Shigeuji, and embezzled the territory of the Kanto Kanrei Uesugi clan in the province, based on which event the Mariya clan emerged and became a warlord.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: そして、この真里谷氏の第5代当主・真里谷信保（恕鑑）には、関東制圧という野望があったが、
sen.e: And Nobuyasu Mariya (Jokan), the fifth head of the Mariya clan, had an ambition of bringing Kanto region under control, but in his neighborhood there were the influence spheres of the Chiba clan & the Yuki clan, both of which had a close relationship with Koga-kubo, so the Mariya clan was also put under their influence.

Nobuyasu Mariya (Jokan), the fifth head of the Mariya clan, had the ambition of bringing Kanto region under his control. But the Chiba clan & the Yuki clan, which both had a close relationship with Koga-kubo, held influence in his neighborhood resulting in the Mariya clan falling under their influence.
Nobuyasu Mariya (Jokan), the fifth head of the Mariya clan, had the ambition of bringing Kanto region under his control.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。

sen.j: 近隣には古河公方と親密な結城氏、千葉氏の勢力が存在し、真里谷氏はその下風に立たざるを得なくなっていた。
sen.e: However, as there were influential families nearby, such as the Yuki clan, the Chiba clan, both of which had close relationship with Koga-kubo, the Mariya clan had no choice but to fall under the sway of their influence.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。氏の順番に沿って並べ替えました。

sen.j: そこで信保は空然に目をつける。
sen.e: And so, Nobuyasu had his eye on Konen.
And so, Nobuyasu had his eye on Konen.
And so, Nobuyasu had his eye on Konen.

sen.j: 信保は永正年間の初め頃に空然を還俗させて足利義明と名乗らせ、下総小弓城に迎えて小弓公方として擁立した。
sen.e: Around the early Eisho era, Nobuyasu had Konen return to secular life, use the name of "Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA," and enter Oyumi-jo Castle in Shimousa Province, and then Nobuyasu helped Yoshiaki into Oyumi-kubo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Around the early Eisho era, Nobuyasu had Konen return to secular life, use the name of "Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA," and enter Oyumi-jo Castle in Shimousa Province, after which then Nobuyasu helped Yoshiaki into Oyumi-kubo.
Around the early Eisho era, Nobuyasu had Konen return to secular life by changing his name to Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA, and brought him into Oyumi-jo Castle in Shimousa Province to make him Oyumi-kubo.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 信保自身は義明を傀儡として実権を掌握すると共に、義明が足利氏の一族であるという大義名分のもとに勢力を関東一帯に拡大していったのである。
sen.e: Placing Yoshiaki as just a figurehead, Nobuyasu himself held real power and extended his own influence over the whole Kanto region under the legitimate reason that Yoshiaki belonged to the Ashikaga family;
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Placing Yoshiaki as just a figurehead, Nobuyasu himself held real power and extended his own influence over the whole Kanto region under the legitimate reason that Yoshiaki belonged to the Ashikaga family;

Installing Yoshiaki as just a figurehead, Nobuyasu himself held the real power and extended his own influence over the whole of the Kanto region under the pretext that Yoshiaki belonged to the Ashikaga family.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: （義明の小弓入城の年次については永正14年説と大永2年説がある）。
sen.e: incidentally, a theory says the year Yoshiaki entered Oyumi-jo Castle was 1517, but another one says it was 1522.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Incidentally, there is a theory that says Yoshiaki entered Oyumi-jo Castle in 1517, but another one holds that it was 1522.
There are two different views on the year of Yoshiaki's entering into Oyumi-jo Castle: 1517 and 1522.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: このため、真里谷氏は信保の時代に全盛期を迎えたが、小弓公方とは真里谷氏の傀儡政権でしかなかった。
sen.e: Therefore, the Mariya clan reached its prime in the era of Nobuyasu, but Oyumi-kubo was just the puppet regime of the Mariya clan at that time.
The Mariya clan subsequently reached its prime in the era of Nobuyasu, but Oyumi-kubo was just a puppet regime of the Mariya clan at the time.
The Mariya clan subsequently reached its prime in the era of Nobuyasu, but Oyumi-kubo was just a puppet regime of the Mariya clan at the time.

tit.j: 小弓公方の全盛期と滅亡
tit.e: The rise and fall of Oyumi-kubo
tit.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: しかし、義明は傀儡の立場で黙っているような人物ではなかった。
sen.e: However, Yoshiaki was not the kind of person who resigned himself to the position of a figurehead.
However, Yoshiaki was not the kind of person who was content to resign himself to the position of a figurehead.
However, Yoshiaki was not the sort of person who could be satisfied with being just a puppet.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 里見氏の内部で発生した稲村の変では義明は真里谷信保に命じて小弓派であった里見義豊の支援に当たらせた。
sen.e: In the Inamura incident that occurred within the Satomi clan, Yoshiaki ordered Nobuyasu MARIYA to back up Yoshitoyo SATOMI who cooperated with Oyumi-kubo.
In the Inamura incident that occurred within the Satomi clan, Yoshiaki ordered Nobuyasu MARIYA to back up Yoshitoyo SATOMI who cooperated with Oyumi-kubo.
During the Inamura incident that occurred within the Satomi clan, Yoshiaki ordered Nobuyasu MARIYA to support Yoshitoyo SATOMI, who was cooperating with Oyumi-kubo.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: だが、義豊は里見義堯に討たれて滅亡してしまう。
sen.e: But Yoshitoyo was killed by Yoshitaka SATOMI.
However, Yoshitoyo was killed by Yoshitaka SATOMI.
However, Yoshitoyo was killed by Yoshitaka SATOMI.

sen.j: そしてこれをきっかけに義明と信保が対立する。
sen.e: And this triggered the conflict between Yoshiaki & Nobuyasu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: This triggered the conflict between Yoshiaki & Nobuyasu.
This triggered the conflict between Yoshiaki & Nobuyasu.

sen.j: その対立に勝利した義明は、信保を出家させた上で強制的に隠居させた。
sen.e: And Yoshiaki won the conflict, had Nobuyasu become a priest, and then forced Nobuyasu to retire.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Yoshiaki won the conflict, had Nobuyasu become a priest, and forced Nobuyasu to retire.
Once Yoshiaki won the conflict, he forced Nobuyasu to retire and become a priest.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 1534年に信保は死去する。
sen.e: In 1534, Nobuyasu died.
In 1534, Nobuyasu died.
Nobuyasu died in 1534.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 死因は病死とも言われているが義明による毒殺説もある。
sen.e: The cause of his death is said to have been some disease, but there is also a theory that he was killed by Yoshiaki with poison.
The cause of his death is said to have been some disease, but there is also a theory that says he was poisined by Yoshiaki.
The cause of his death is said to have been some disease, but there is also a theory that says he was poisoned by Yoshiaki.

sen.j: やがて、真里谷氏内部で真里谷信隆と真里谷信応兄弟による家督争いが起こると、義明は里見義堯を自派に引き入れて信応を支持して信隆を追放するなど、巧みに真里谷氏の争いに介入する。
sen.e: After a while, a succession dispute occurred within the Mariya clan between Nobutaka MARIYA & his younger half brother Nobumasa MARIYA, when Yoshiaki intervened in the dispute by winning over Yoshitaka SATOMI to his side, backing up Nobumasa, and expelling Nobutaka.

After a while, a successive dispute occurred within the Mariya clan between Nobutaka MARIYA & his younger half brother Nobumasa MARIYA. When Yoshiaki intervened in the dispute, he brought Yoshitaka SATOMI to his side, backed up Nobumasa, and expelled Nobutaka.

After a while, a successive dispute occurred within the Mariya clan between Nobutaka MARIYA & his younger half brother Nobumasa MARIYA. When Yoshiaki intervened in the dispute, he brought Yoshitaka SATOMI to his side, backed up Nobumasa, and expelled Nobutaka.

sen.j: こうして、義明は傀儡の立場から脱却し、正式な小弓公方として台頭する。
sen.e: In this way, Yoshiaki freed himself from the position of a figurehead and gained real power as Oyumi-kubo.
In this way, Yoshiaki freed himself being a figurehead and gained power as Oyumi-kubo.
In this way, Yoshiaki freed himself being a figurehead and gained power as the official Oyumi-kubo.
sen.cmt: 正式な を追加しました。

sen.j: そして同族である古河公方家や後北条氏と対立し、小弓公方家による南関東諸大名の統合を名分として急速に勢力を拡大してゆくこととなった。
sen.e: Then Yoshiaki conflicted with both the Koga-kubo family (his own relatives) & the Gohojo clan, and he extended his power rapidly under the legitimate reason of the Oyumi-kubo family's integrating feudal lords in southern Kanto region.

Yoshiaki then engaged in conflict with both the Koga-kubo family (his own relatives) & the Gohojo clan, extending his power rapidly with the legitimate reason of the Oyumi-kubo family's integrating feudal lords in the southern Kanto region.

He conflicted with the Koga-kubo family of his same blood and the Gohojo clan, and rapidly extended his power on the pretext of integrating the feudal lords in the southern Kanto region by the Oyumi-kubo family.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: しかし、このような小弓公方家の急速な勢力拡大は後北条氏や古河公方家に危機感を抱かせ、両者に同盟を結ばせるに至った。
sen.e: However, the Gohojo clan & Koga-kubo family had a sense of crisis with such a rapid power extension of Oyumi-kubo, so they concluded an alliance with each other.
However, the Gohojo clan & Koga-kubo family, sensing a crisis with the rapid gains in power by Oyumi-kubo, formed an alliance with each other.
This rapid expansion of the influence of the Oyumi-kubo family had set the Gohojo clan and the Koga-kubo family on their guard, which resulted in the alliance between these two families.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 義明は古河公方と後北条氏が結びつくのを食い止めるため、1538年に真里谷信応や里見義堯ら房総の諸大名による軍勢を率いて北条氏綱・足利晴氏連合軍との決戦を決意する。
sen.e: To prevent Koga-kubo & the Gohojo clan from linking, Yoshiaki decided in 1538 to fight with the allied forces of Ujitsuna HOJO & Haruuji ASHIKAGA, leading the forces of Nobumasa MARIYA, Yoshitaka SATOMI and other feudal lords in the Boso Peninsula.

To prevent Koga-kubo & the Gohojo clan from linking, Yoshiaki decided in 1538 to fight with the allied forces of Ujitsuna HOJO & Haruuji ASHIKAGA, leading the forces of Nobumasa MARIYA, Yoshitaka SATOMI and other feudal lords in the Boso Peninsula.

To prevent Koga-kubo and the Gohojo clan from joining forces, Yoshiaki decided in 1538 to lead the armies of Nobumasa MARIYA, Yoshitaka SATOMI, and other feudal lords from the Boso Peninsula into a decisive battle against the allied forces of Ujitsuna HOJO and Haruuji ASHIKAGA.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: いわゆる第一次国府台合戦である。
sen.e: This was what we call the First Konodai Battle.
This was what we call the First Konodai Battle.
This was what we call the First Konodai Battle.

sen.j: 義明は武勇に優れ、自ら陣頭で指揮するなど奮戦し、一時は北条・足利軍を大いに押した。
sen.e: Yoshiaki had bravery & fine skills in martial arts, and he fought hard by taking the lead himself at the battlefront, so his forces stood superior to the allied forces of Hojo & Ashikaga for some time.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Yoshiaki was renowned for his bravery & martial arts skills, and he fought hard by taking the lead himself at the battlefront, so his forces stood superior to the allied forces of Hojo & Ashikaga for some time.
With his great military prowess, Yoshiaki took command and fought so bravely at the front of the battle that his army overwhelmed the allied forces of the Hojo and the Ashikaga for a while.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: しかし、里見軍は義堯がもともとこの戦いに消極的であったためにあまり協力的ではなかった。
sen.e: But the forces of the Satomi clan were not cooperative owing to Yoshiaki's reluctant attitude to this battle from the start.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: But the forces of the Satomi clan were uncooperative owing to Yoshiaki's reluctant attitude in the battle from the start.
However, the army of the Satomi clan was not so cooperative in the battle because Yoshitaka had been reluctant to support the battle from the beginning.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: また真里谷氏内部にも家督争いに介入した義明に対して不快感を抱いていた者がいた。
sen.e: And some people within the Mariya clan were offended by Yoshiaki's intervention in the succession dispute.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Some people within the Mariya clan were offended by Yoshiaki's intervention in the dispute over succession.
Some people within the Mariya clan were offended by Yoshiaki's intervention in the dispute over the succession.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: したがって、義明ら房総軍の士気はあまり高くなかった。
sen.e: Therefore, on the whole, the morale of Yoshiaki's forces composed of feudal lords in the Boso Peninsula was not so high.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Therefore, on the whole, the morale of Yoshiaki's forces composed of feudal lords in the Boso Peninsula was relatively low.
Therefore, on the whole, the morale of Yoshiaki's forces composed of feudal lords in the Boso Peninsula was relatively low.

sen.j: そのため、義明らの軍勢はやがて北条軍の反撃を受けて壊滅し、義明自身も討ち死にした。
sen.e: And so, before long, Yoshiaki's forces were destroyed completely by the counterattack of the Hojo clan's forces, and Yoshiaki himself was killed in the battle.
Before long, Yoshiaki's forces were completely destroyed by the counterattack from the Hojo clan's forces, and Yoshiaki himself was killed in the battle.
Before long, Yoshiaki's forces were completely destroyed by the counterattack from the Hojo clan's forces, and Yoshiaki himself was killed in the battle.

sen.j: 義明の戦死後、小弓城は北条氏の支援を受けた千葉氏が奪還したために義明の遺族は里見氏を頼って安房国に逃れた。
sen.e: After Yoshiaki's death, Oyumi-jo Castle was recaptured by the Chiba clan backed up by the Hojo clan, so the bereaved family of Yoshiaki fled to Awa Province falling back on the Satomi clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: After Yoshiaki's death, Oyumi-jo Castle was recaptured by the Chiba clan, which was backed up by the Hojo clan, so the bereaved family of Yoshiaki fled to Awa Province falling back on the Satomi clan.

As Oyumi-jo Castle was retaken by the Chiba clan under the support of the Hojo clan after Yoshiaki's death, the surviving members of his family fled to Awa Province asking for the help of the Satomi clan.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: これにより小弓公方は事実上滅亡した。
sen.e: Practically this put an end to Oyumi-kubo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Practically this put an end to Oyumi-kubo.
This practically put an end to Oyumi-kubo.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

tit.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 小弓公方の滅亡により、北条氏の南関東における覇権確立の基礎が固められた。
sen.e: The end of Oyumi-kubo enabled the Hojo clan to strengthen the basis to establish its supremacy in southern Kanto region.
The end of Oyumi-kubo enabled the Hojo clan to strengthen its base and establish its supremacy in southern Kanto region.
The end of Oyumi-kubo enabled the Hojo clan to strengthen its base and establish its supremacy in southern Kanto region.

sen.j: また、義明の死去により真里谷氏では再び信応と信隆による家督争いが起こり、家運は急速に衰退する。
sen.e: And Yoshiaki's death caused the succession dispute to come back within the Mariya clan between Nobumasa & Nobutaka, so the family fortunes declined rapidly.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Yoshiaki's death caused the dispute over succession to return within the Mariya clan between Nobumasa & Nobutaka, resutling in a decline in the family fortunes.
Due to the death of Yoshiaki, the dispute over succession occurred again between Nobumasa and Nobutaka in the Mariya clan, which resulted in the rapid decline of the family fortunes.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: やがて里見氏に攻められて、真里谷氏は北条氏康の家臣として仕えることとなった。
sen.e: Before long the Mariya clan was attacked by the Satomi clan, and in the end they became retainers of Ujiyasu HOJO.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Before long the Mariya clan was attacked by the Satomi clan, and in the end they became retainers of Ujiyasu HOJO.
Before long the Mariya clan was attacked by the Satomi clan, and in the end they became retainers of Ujiyasu HOJO.
sen.cmt: FBには、became the retainers…とありますが、真里谷氏だけが家臣となったわけではないので、became retainers のままにしています。

sen.j: 義明の一族のうち、長女青岳尼は初め鎌倉の太平寺に尼として預けられていた。
sen.e: Of all members of the bereaved family of Yoshiaki, his first daughter Shogakuni was at first left as a nun to the Taihei-ji Temple in Kamakura.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Of all members of the bereaved family of Yoshiaki, his first daughter Shogakuni was at first left as a nun to the Taihei-ji Temple in Kamakura.
Among the surviving family members of deceased Yoshiaki, his first daughter, Shogakuni, was initially sheltered as a nun in the Taihei-ji Temple in Kamakura.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: のちに彼女は里見義堯の嫡男里見義弘の懇願によりその正室となる。
sen.e: Later she became the lawful wife of Yoshihiro SATOMI, the heir of Yoshitaka SATOMI, at Yoshihiro's entreaty.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Later she became the lawful wife of Yoshihiro SATOMI, the heir of Yoshitaka SATOMI, at Yoshihiro's entreaty.
Later, she became the lawful wife of Yoshihiro SATOMI, who was the legitimate son of Yoshitaka SATOMI, by accepting his marriage proposal.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: これによって義明の旧臣もその多くが里見氏に仕える事となった。
sen.e: With this marriage, most of former vassals of Yoshiaki became retainers of the Satomi clan.
With this marriage, most former vassals of Yoshiaki became retainers of the Satomi clan.
With this marriage, most former vassals of Yoshiaki became retainers of the Satomi clan.
sen.cmt: FBには、became the retainers…とありますが、義明の旧臣だけが家臣となったわけではないので、became retainers のままにしています。

sen.j: 義明の嫡男足利義純 (戦国時代)は国府台で父と共に戦死した。
sen.e: Meanwhile, Yoshizumi ASHIKAGA, the heir of Yoshiaki, was killed along with his father in the battle at Konodai.
Meanwhile, Yoshizumi ASHIKAGA, the heir of Yoshiaki, was killed along with his father in the battle at Konodai.
Meanwhile, Yoshizumi ASHIKAGA, the heir of Yoshiaki, was killed along with his father in the battle at Konodai.

sen.j: 次男の足利頼純（頼淳）は父の死後、里見氏の庇護を受けて成長する。
sen.e: Yorizumi ASHIKAGA, the second son of Yoshiaki, grew up under the protection of the Satomi clan from his father's death.
Yorizumi ASHIKAGA, the second son of Yoshiaki, grew up under the protection of the Satomi clan from his father's death.
Yorizumi ASHIKAGA, the second son of Yoshiaki, grew up under the patronage of the Satomi clan after his father's death.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: その後、しばらくは諸国を流浪するが、やがて娘が天下人である豊臣秀吉の側室となった。
sen.e: Afterward, Yorizumi drifted from one province to another for some time, and after a while, his daughter became a concubine of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, the then "tenkabito" (the person becoming the ruler of the country).
Afterward, Yorizumi drifted from one province to another for some time, and after a while, his daughter became a concubine of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, the then "tenkabito" (ruler of the country).
Afterward, Yorizumi drifted from one province to another for some time, and after a while, his daughter became a concubine of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, the then Tenkabito (ruler of the country).
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。しかし the then を使用しない、という指示がありますが、英語の表記上問題ないと思われます。

sen.j: 小田原の役が始まると、頼純は里見氏の支援を受けて千葉氏を破って小弓城を取り戻して数ヶ月間ながら小弓公方を復活させた。
sen.e: When the Siege of Odawara (the war waged by Hideyoshi against the Hojo clan) began, Yorizumi defeated the Chiba clan and got back Oyumi-jo Castle thanks to the Satomi clan's support, and then Yorizumi revived Oyumi-kubo, just few months as it was;
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: When the Siege of Odawara (the war waged by Hideyoshi against the Hojo clan) began, Yorizumi defeated the Chiba clan and won the Oyumi-jo Castle back thanks to support from the Satomi clan, afterwhich Yorizumi revived Oyumi-kubo, if even for a few months;

After the Siege of Odawara (the war waged by Hideyoshi against the Hojo clan) broke out, Yorizumi defeated the Chiba clan and recovered the Oyumi-jo Castle under the support of the Satomi clan, which led to the resurgence of Oyumi-kubo even only for a few months.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: （豊臣氏家臣山中長俊から増田長盛にあてた関東処分に関する報告書においても頼純が小弓に滞在している事を示唆している。）
sen.e: the fact that Yorizumi stayed in Oyumi was suggested in reports of how to handle postwar Kanto region, which were sent from Nagatoshi YAMANAKA to Nagamori MASHITA, both the vassals of the Toyotomi clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: the fact that Yorizumi stayed in Oyumi was suggested in reports of how to handle postwar Kanto region, which were sent from Nagatoshi YAMANAKA to Nagamori MASHITA, both the vassals of the Toyotomi clan.

In the report of Nagatoshi YAMANAKA, a vassal of the Toyotomi clan, regarding the postwar settlement of Kanto region, which was addressed to his counterpart, Nagamori MASHITA, it was also indicated that Yorizumi had been in Oyumi.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 北条氏の滅亡後、頼純の長男足利国朝も秀吉の計らいにより足利氏姫（最後の古河公方である足利義氏 (古河公方)の娘）と結婚を許された。
sen.e: After the Hojo clan fell, Kunitomo ASHIKAGA, the first son of Yorizumi, was allowed at Hideyoshi's discretion to marry Ujihime ASHIKAGA, the daughter of Yoshiuji ASHIKAGA (the last Koga-kubo).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: After the Hojo clan fell, Kunitomo ASHIKAGA, the first son of Yorizumi, was allowed at Hideyoshi's discretion to marry Ujihime ASHIKAGA, the daughter of Yoshiuji ASHIKAGA (the last Koga-kubo).
After the Hojo clan fell, Kunitomo ASHIKAGA, the first son of Yorizumi, was allowed at Hideyoshi's discretion to marry Ujihime ASHIKAGA, the daughter of Yoshiuji ASHIKAGA (the last Koga-kubo).

sen.j: これにより、義明の系統は喜連川氏として存続することになった。
sen.e: And this enabled the lineage of Yoshiaki to continue as the Kitsuregawa clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: This enabled the lineage of Yoshiaki to continue as the Kitsuregawa clan.
Together they started a new branch of the Ashikaga family called the Kitsuregawa clan, enabling the continuation of Yoshiaki's family line.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 江戸時代においても、かつて将軍家であった足利氏の伝統を重んじた徳川家康は、石高4500石の足利頼氏に10万石の家格を与え、喜連川藩として存続させた。
sen.e: And also in the Edo period, Ieyasu TOKUGAWA gave "Kakaku" (the family status) of one tenth million koku to Yoriuji ASHIKAGA (Yoshiaki's grandson) who had only 4500 koku, and allowed the family to continue as the Kitsuregawa Clan, because Ieyasu respected the tradition of the Ashikaga Shogunate family.

Also, during the Edo period, Ieyasu TOKUGAWA gave "Kakaku" (the family status) of one tenth million koku to Yoriuji ASHIKAGA (Yoshiaki's grandson) who had only 4500 koku, and allowed the family to continue as the Kitsuregawa Clan, because Ieyasu respected the tradition of the Ashikaga Shogunate family.

Even in the Edo period, considering the background of the Ashikaga Family as the former shogunate, Ieyasu TOKUGAWA granted Kakaku (the family status) equivalent to the yield of 100,000 koku to Yoriuji ASHIKAGA, who had originally been entitled to only 4,500 koku, and allowed the family to continue as the Kitsuregawa clan.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 実際は1万石にも満たないが、特別に認められた異例の藩となった。
sen.e: The clan's real revenue fell short of ten thousand koku, but the permission itself for the clan to exist was extraordinary.
Despite the clan's real revenue falling short of ten thousand koku, it was permitted to exist as an exception.
It was an exceptional case in which the feudal domain yielding less than 10,000 koku in fact was approved to exist as clan.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しましたkokuを加えました。Hanをclanに変更しました。actually →in factに変更しました。

sen.e: Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA - from (supposedly) 1517 to 1538
Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA - from (supposedly) 1517 to 1538
Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA - from (supposedly) 1517 to 1538

sen.j: 足利頼純 1590年?
sen.e: Yorizumi ASHIKAGA -(supposedly) 1590
Yorizumi ASHIKAGA -(supposedly) 1590
Yorizumi ASHIKAGA -(supposedly) 1590
